availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
The State of Massachusetts
County of
City of Boston

I, William H. Towne having been duly appointed & commissioned by his Excellency Thos E. Bramlette Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky a Commissioner of Deeds (in Massachusetts) for the State of Kentucky, for the term of four years from 5th day of October 1864 -- do swear that I will well & truly execute & perfom all the duties of my station as such commissioner. So help me God

Sworn to by the said Wm H. Towne before me and by him subscribed in my presence, at Boston Massachusetts this the 11 day of October 1864, as witness my hand and seal affixed on the day & date aforesaid.

Comr Deeds
Massachusetts
Oath of Wm H. Towne
Filed 14th
Oct/64. Date
of Comrmission
5th Oct/64
